Here you will find the least and most remembered U.S. presidents in order of the number of letters in their last names (least to most), as well as how your score stacks up against everyone else who took this quiz.
Think you can do better this time? Play Again . Popular Just For Fun games today Visual Typing Challenge 23663 Clickable 1-100 Mines 18802 Missing Word: 2007 Movies 9996 Word Ladder: Deer Season 7645 1-100 1982 Missing Word: 2010 Movie Titles 1521 Shape-ology 1193 And more...

Archived comments: show them gwukelic : Feb 22nd, 2011 at 02:23 GMT 6 points This is a sequel to my U.S. state quiz. I hope you like this one, and if you really enjoy it, here's the link to the other one. http://www.sporcle.com/games/gwukelic/big_words_hurt_my_brain Comment below threshold: show it siciliana099 : Feb 23rd, 2011 at 01:14 GMT -18 points not good
micah : Mar 9th, 2011 at 05:47 GMT 8 points You know what I hate? When I miss Lincoln because, when I'm at the end and running through all the presidents in my mind, Lincoln is so obvious that I figure surely I couldn't have forgotten him. That's what.
MikeN : Mar 9th, 2011 at 18:17 GMT -2 points THe first letter makes it too easy. Just have them be entered in alphabetical order within each length.
iamthesecretbox : Mar 11th, 2011 at 22:28 GMT 4 points looks like you ran out of room in the title lol Game published: Mar 16th, 2011 at 04:03 GMT gwukelic : Mar 16th, 2011 at 04:08 GMT 31 points Many thanks to Sporcle for publishing my quiz! I hope you all enjoy it. :)
punniker : Mar 16th, 2011 at 04:50 GMT 52 points there will soon be a day when all of the ways to name the presidents of the USA have been submitted.
Sulli : Mar 16th, 2011 at 04:51 GMT 3 points i cant believe i missed 6
glueyourfingers : Mar 16th, 2011 at 05:13 GMT 26 points Loved this more than I thought I would. I'd love to see the format carried over to US states, countries of Africa, etc.
fcogcommish : Mar 16th, 2011 at 05:35 GMT 6 points Love the President's quizzes. Always challenging. I never remember Hayes. Why is that? How can I always remember Arthur and Fillmore and forget Rutherford? Comment below threshold: show it BamaRainbow : Mar 16th, 2011 at 05:47 GMT -15 points My only complaint was that I spent a good 30 seconds on the first "J-7" because it wouldn't take my (correct) answer. Where there are "ties" on possible answers, some sort of "tiebreaker" needs to be indicated in the instructions. All we're told is to enter last names. (An indication for alphabetical order where multiple choices are possible would help.)
gwukelic : Mar 16th, 2011 at 06:05 GMT 11 points @BamaRainbow: I do mention that in the game notes, but I understand that most people don't read that. @All: As a reminder, all names are LAST NAMES and in the event of a tie (the same amount of letters), enter the last names in order alphabetically.
gwukelic : Mar 16th, 2011 at 06:08 GMT 7 points One more thing. If you enjoyed this quiz, I have an original quiz similar to this, but involving the US States. I will mostly make more quizzes like this if this quiz does well. Anyway, I encourage you to try my first one. Here's the link: http://www.sporcle.com/games/gwukelic/big_words_hurt_my_brain
sooners : Mar 16th, 2011 at 06:37 GMT 1 point I always forget Obama, I'm not sure how to fit him into that president's song from elementary school :(
TessSGS : Mar 16th, 2011 at 07:27 GMT 12 points Missed 2, McKinley and Cleveland, not bad for a Brit.
pirate6711 : Mar 16th, 2011 at 11:31 GMT 3 points Good quiz and a good amount of time to complete. It presents a good and realistic challenge.
Hullabaloo : Mar 16th, 2011 at 11:42 GMT -1 points My knowledge of US presidents is a bit rusty to say the least. Got 29 though, so I can't complain too much. Nice quiz, cheif.
Retracto : Mar 16th, 2011 at 12:22 GMT 7 points Gah! Missed Clinton, of all people. My poor head gets stuck in a historical mode.
olegauchos : Mar 16th, 2011 at 16:17 GMT 5 points First in war, first in peace, first in number of letters
monstro : Mar 16th, 2011 at 16:31 GMT 2 points Got all but McKinley, then it seemed a bit odd to see that he was the most-missed. Come on, brain, there's a mountain named after him!
WyattsTorch : Mar 16th, 2011 at 16:48 GMT 1 point I missed Gore. Oh wait...
jojofiss : Mar 16th, 2011 at 17:17 GMT 3 points "And they made it their sign, because, Van Buren, our 8th President, was the man they most admired."
lynnline : Mar 16th, 2011 at 18:19 GMT 1 point Could not think of the "V" president for the life of me! Surprised I got tripped up as much as I did. Good quiz!
Nordeck52 : Mar 16th, 2011 at 18:22 GMT 1 point Can't believe I missed Clinton. I guess I was also in "history mode" or something like that. x.x
44magnum : Mar 16th, 2011 at 18:24 GMT 1 point It took a few tries but I finally got them all. Missed different ones each time. This was a good quiz. Congrats on getting it published.
yankeespurs101 : Mar 16th, 2011 at 18:26 GMT 5 points Its probably easier if you go through all the presidents in your head and fill it in that way instead of guessing
abard124 : Mar 16th, 2011 at 22:30 GMT 7 points Damn good thing Arnold Schwarzenegger isn't eligible to be president...
mustango : Mar 16th, 2011 at 23:42 GMT 3 points For P-6 I so got hung up on President Palmer.
EpicWinFTW : Mar 17th, 2011 at 02:13 GMT 3 points ...Truman *in Jerry Seinfeld's voice*
Supersonicfan3 : Mar 17th, 2011 at 03:39 GMT 2 points brilliant jojofuss, just brilliant!
Girma : Mar 23rd, 2011 at 23:05 GMT 2 points I would like to thank the Animaniacs' "President song" for this success.
bballcenter7 : Apr 15th, 2011 at 13:46 GMT 2 points 41/43. The two I missed? Reagan and Lincoln X_X
ewanmcfadyen : Jun 1st, 2011 at 03:57 GMT 2 points For the long "G" I nearly tried Gerald Ford
Mizzie : Jun 13th, 2011 at 00:26 GMT 2 points I was racking my brains for the first two 'B's...the only B I could think of was Buchanan. My brain, for some reason, thought "butter" was an answer...WTF, self.
psylockecable : Apr 9th, 2012 at 16:03 GMT 0 points Filmore has one L. 2007-12©Sporcle, Inc. - About | Advertise | Feedback | Blog | FAQ | Embed | News | Terms | Jobs | Privacy Part of USA Today Sports Media Group Go to the Sporcle.com Mobile Site→
